pullRequest.title: Optimize IProfiler fan-in info serialization
pullRequest.bodyText:
Previously, serializing TR_IPMethodHashTableEntry to
TR_ContiguousIPMethodHashTableEntry required memsetting
the contiguous entry to 0 on the client, so when
the next element in the serialized array of callers is NULL,
server would know that it reached the end.
This commit adds _callerCount field to the contiguous entry,
so that client doesn't have to perform a memset since server
is informed how many callers are present.

beforeCommit.message:
Optimize IProfiler fan-in info serialization

Previously, serializing `TR_IPMethodHashTableEntry` to
`TR_ContiguousIPMethodHashTableEntry` required memsetting
the contiguous entry to 0 on the client, so when
the next element in the serialized array of callers is NULL,
server would know that it reached the end.

This commit adds `_callerCount` field to the contiguous entry,
so that client doesn't have to perform a memset since server
is informed how many callers are present.

Signed-off-by: dmitry-ten <candalistic@gmail.com>

beforeCommit.message:
Optimize IProfiler fan-in info serialization

Previously, serializing `TR_IPMethodHashTableEntry` to

afterCommit.message:
Optimize IProfiler fan-in info serialization

Previously, serializing `TR_IPMethodHashTableEntry` to
`TR_ContiguousIPMethodHashTableEntry` required memsetting
the contiguous entry to 0 on the client, so when
the next element in the serialized array of callers is NULL,
server would know that it reached the end.

This commit adds `_callerCount` field to the contiguous entry,
so that client doesn't have to perform a memset since server
is informed how many callers are present.

Also modify serialization function for method entries to remove
one round of copying.

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Ten <Dmitry.Ten@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Small tweak: take this increment out of the for loop and at the end just add serialEntry->_callerCount=callerIdx;

reserve will not work here because the size of the string is not adjusted. We need to do std::string entryStr(sizeof(TR_ContiguousIPMethodHashTableEntry), 0)
An alternative is to resize the string before calling serialize:
entryStr.resize(sizeof(TR_ContiguousIPMethodHashTableEntry))` which fills it with 0 as well
We could also another resize after the string is filled because we know how many entries are stored. This will limit the amount of empty data transferred to and from network.
